intro.p: A new study was conducted to determine if exercise could treat anxiety. Researchers studied {{n}} {{age}} with anxiety syndrome. Patients were randomly assigned to either a moderate exercise group, a strenuous exercise group, or to a group who received advice on physical activity. Anxiety symptoms in all three groups were measured at the beginning and the end of the study by observers who {{blinding}}. Researchers found that both moderate and strenuous exercise groups had a greater reduction in anxiety symptoms compared to the group just getting advice on physical activity. {{results}}.
